posts.post_content: Do consider his CMC that he comes in the late game to finish up what little lif your opponent has left. He comes in fifth turn, by then your opponent's life count should be below 8 or 6, he's the back-up to ensue your opponent will get burned.

posts.post_content:
Limited: yes, lots of ammo in scars for him and can dominate the board.
  
Constructed: No. At that CMC in red, this is very underwhelming. At that CMC in red, you get a chandra nalaar, much better at finishing off your opponent. We need decent red artifact deck oriented creatures for constructed, if they're serious about red artifact.
posts.html:
Limited: yes, lots of ammo in scars for him and can dominate the board.
Constructed: No. At that CMC in red, this is very underwhelming. At that CMC in red, you get a chandra nalaar, much better at finishing off your opponent. We need decent red artifact deck oriented creatures for constructed, if they're serious about red artifact.

posts.post_content: Card is a throwback to [Heartwood Giant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartwood Giant) in terms of mana cost and activated ability. This throws artifacts, not trees. And it's a 3/3, not a 4/4. But still sweet I guess. Just not as sweet as the Giant was.
